translation: Dhāraṇī of the World Bearer

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師玄奘奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by Imperial Decree by Xuanzang, Master of the Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang
Thus I've heard.
One time, the Blessed One, the Bhagavān, was building a conglomerate in Kauśāmbī.
He was in Kauśāmbī and built the Śākyamuni Grove.
He was accompanied by a large congregation of 500 monks.

source_sentence: 菩薩摩訶薩俱胝數及諸天人阿素洛等無量大眾前後圍繞。
translation: They were surrounded by an incalculable number of bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, gods, asuras, and other people.

source_sentence: 時彼國中有一長者名為妙月。
translation: At the time, there was an elder in that country named Miaoyue.
His appearance was warm and flashy, and his intentions were refined.
There were many men, women, and servants.
They had deep respect for and faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha.
They came to the Buddha and bowed their heads at his feet.
They circled him a hundred thousand times and withdrew to one side.
They put their palms together in respect and said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊欲問如來應正等覺少所疑事。
translation: "The Bhagavān wants to ask the Tathāgata, the Worthy and Completely Enlightened One, about a few things that he has doubts about.
Please have the great kindness to listen and allow it!
It was then that the Bhagavān took pity on them.
With a kind and gentle voice, he told them.
"Sir, please feel free to ask as you wish.

source_sentence: 吾當為汝方便分別令汝心喜。
translation: I will skillfully discern for you what will please your heart.'
That elder then rejoiced and jumped for joy.
He bowed his head, put his palms together, and invited him to come forward.

source_sentence: 世尊云何善男子善女人。
translation: "Bhagavān, what is it, good sons and good women?
Can poor people be made rich and poor?
Those who are sick may be cured of their illnesses.
Those who are guilty can be made to cease their sins.
Those who are frightened can be made comfortable.
Knowing this, the Bhagavān then asked.
"What is the reason the elder made such a request?
The elder then repeatedly said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊我等在家多諸眷屬。
translation: "Bhagavān, we're at home with many dependents.
Our possessions are scarce, and it's difficult to help them.
We're also suffering from many illnesses, sins, and fears.
Therefore, I'd like the Bhagavān to show us the way.
Enable the poor and disadvantaged to attain a position of great wealth.
He will give generously to his family and cultivate generosity.
It will benefit all the storehouses without limit.
It will cause those who are sick to have their four major powers harmonized.
They diligently cultivate good actions without physical or mental restlessness.
They cause those who are guilty to be quickly removed.
Their bodies may perish and their lives may end, and they'll be born in a good destiny.
It causes those who are frightened to be at peace with body and mind.
They become intimate with and make offerings to the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha.
They'll quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed that elder.

source_sentence: 善男子我於過去無數劫前遇佛世尊。
translation: "Good sons, I met the Bhagavān an uncountable number of eons ago.

source_sentence: 名持金剛海音如來應正等覺明行圓滿善逝世間解無上丈夫調御士天人師佛薄伽梵。
translation: He was called Vajragarbha Tathāgata, Worthy of Correct Enlightenment, Perfectly Accomplished in Knowledge and Conduct, Well Gone, Worldly Understander, Unsurpassed Husband, Tamer of Gods, Teacher of Men, and Buddha Bhagavān.
It was for the benefit and welfare of sentient beings that he spoke the dhāraṇī name Śubhavyūha.
He taught them the dhāraṇī called 'maintaining the world.'
When I heard it, I rejoiced and jumped for joy.
I memorized it, recited it, and taught it to others.
It benefited and comforted measureless sentient beings.
Because of these causes and conditions, merit and wisdom grew.
I quickly realized unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.
He teaches the subtle Dharma to gods and humans.
Now, I'll explain this dhāraṇī for you.
You gods and humans should all listen closely.
After hearing it, they should memorize it and explain it widely to others.
The power of this incalculable dhāraṇī is inconceivable.
It causes all sentient beings to attain benefit and happiness.'
The dhāraṇī says.

source_sentence: 呾姪他　蘇魯閉　跋達邏筏底　瞢揭麗　頞折麗　頞摺鉢麗　喝伽哳尼　喝鞞達尼　薩寫罰底　馱娜罰底　達那罰底　室利沫底　鉢拉婆罰底　罯沫麗　毘沫麗　魯盧蘇　縷波毘沫麗　頞捺捺悉諦　毘呾悉諦　毘濕縛繫　始[狂-王+央]矩麗　茫矩麗　毘毘謎　杜杜謎　呾呾麗　呾洛呾洛　罰折麗罰折麗　羯[齒*來]羯[齒*來](去聲)罰栗殺尼　昵澁波達尼　罰折洛達洛　呾他揭多薩點　娑揭洛　昵懼衫　呾他揭耽頞　奴颯沫洛　颯沫洛達磨薩點颯沫洛　僧伽薩點颯沫洛呾吒呾吒　譜洛譜洛　譜刺耶　跋洛跋洛　尼蘇瞢揭麗　扇多沫底　瞢揭羅罰底　蘇跋達洛罰底　阿揭車阿揭車　三沫閻阿奴颯沫洛莎訶　阿罰制喃　頞奴颯沫洛莎呵　鉢刺婆(去聲)凡頞奴颯沫洛莎呵　絰栗砧　頞奴颯沫洛莎訶　毘折閻　頞奴颯沫洛莎訶　薩縛薩埵毘捺閻頞奴颯沫莎呵此陀羅尼具大神力。
translation: 呾姪他　蘇魯閉　跋達邏筏底　瞢揭麗　頞折麗　頞摺鉢麗　喝伽哳尼　喝鞞達尼　薩寫罰底　馱娜罰底　達那罰底　室利沫底　鉢拉婆罰底　罯沫麗　毘沫麗　魯盧蘇　縷波毘沫麗　頞捺捺悉諦　毘呾悉諦　毘濕縛繫　始[狂-王+央]矩麗　茫矩麗　毘毘謎　杜杜謎　呾呾麗　呾洛呾洛　罰折麗罰折麗　羯[齒*來]羯[齒*來](去聲)罰栗殺尼　昵澁波達尼　罰折洛達洛　呾他揭多薩點　娑揭洛　昵懼衫　呾他揭耽頞　奴颯沫洛　颯沫洛達磨薩點颯沫洛　僧伽薩點颯沫洛呾吒呾吒　譜洛譜洛　譜刺耶　跋洛跋洛　尼蘇瞢揭麗　扇多沫底　瞢揭羅罰底　蘇跋達洛罰底　阿揭車阿揭車　三沫閻阿奴颯沫洛莎訶　阿罰制喃　頞奴颯沫洛莎呵　鉢刺婆(去聲)凡頞奴颯沫洛莎呵　絰栗砧　頞奴颯沫洛莎訶　毘折閻　頞奴颯沫洛莎訶　薩縛薩埵毘捺閻頞奴颯沫莎呵此陀羅尼具大神力。
Suppose there are good men and good women.
wholeheartedly accept it and teach it widely for others.
"Bad spirits, ghosts, gods, dragons, and yakṣas won't be harmed by humans or non-humans.
Neither humans nor non-humans can harm them.
Their benefits and pleasures will increase day and night.
Suppose you can sincerely make offerings to the Three Treasures.
Recite this great dhāraṇī with sincerity.
It lasts for seven days and nights, and there's no time when it's missing.
The gods and dragons rejoice.
From the end of time, the darkness rains down the necessary provisions.
All hunger, famine, and epidemics are completely eliminated.
All the sins and hindrances are invariably extinguished.
All fears and dangers are made tranquil.
Their merits and wisdom gradually increase, and they pursue them as intended.
They'll quickly realize unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and bodhi.
It was then that the Buddha addressed Gṛhapati Māluṅkyaputta.
"You should faithfully accept this dhāraṇī.
Recite it, memorize it, uphold it, and teach it widely for others.
Nothing that you seek will be gained or enjoyed that isn't in harmony with it.
That elder then heard what the Buddha taught.
He rejoiced and jumped up and down, saying to the Buddha.
"I can memorize it and teach it widely for others.
It will benefit and bring comfort to measureless sentient beings.
Please have compassion and watch over him, Bhagavān.
The Bhagavān told him, "So it is.
That elder then put his palms together in respect.
After circling the Bhagavān a hundred thousand times to his right, he bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and rejoiced.
He bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and rejoiced.
It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda.
"The treasury of Gṛhapati Māluṅkyaputta is full of various kinds of goods and grains.
Now, they're all full of various treasures.'
Venerable Ānanda rejoiced and said to the Buddha.
"What are the causes for that, Gṛhapati Māluṅkyaputta?
The treasury suddenly filled up.
The Buddha told Ānanda, "Venerable Māluṅkyaputta!
"He heard what I taught about the great dhāraṇī.
He deeply believes, rejoices, memorizes, and recites it.
May I explain it for measureless sentient beings.
Because of this merit, the treasury is full.

source_sentence: 滿汝等亦應受持讀誦廣為他說此陀羅尼。
translation: You should also retain, recite, and read this dhāraṇī, explaining it widely for others.
That will cause these 3,000 great one-thousand worlds.
All sentient beings in this world will attain benefit and happiness.
I've observed that gods, Māra, Brahmā, and others in the world.
Nothing in the world like Māra or Brahmā can disparage this dhāraṇī.
Its words are true and indestructible.
Weakly endowed people can't hear it.
Why is it that such a statement is praised by the buddhas of the three times?
The buddhas of the three times all praise it together.
It's bestowed with inconceivable miraculous powers.
It causes those who hear and uphold it to attain benefit and happiness.
Venerable Ānanda was profoundly delighted.
He praised it as a wonderful kārttika.

source_sentence: 諸佛不思議　　所說法亦爾
translation: 'The buddhas are inconceivable, and so is the teaching.'

source_sentence: 能正奉行者　　果報亦復然
translation: The rewards of those who correctly practice are likewise.

source_sentence: 一切智法王　　滅生老病死
translation: Dharma-king of omniscience who extinguishes birth, aging, sickness, and death

source_sentence: 已到勝彼岸　　稽首大覺尊
translation: having reached the other shore, I bow my head to the Most Venerable Enlightened One
Ānanda then leapt for joy.
He bowed his palms to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!
"Bhagavān, what's the name of this teaching?
How can we now consecrate it?
The Buddha told Ānanda.
"It's called the question of Gṛhapati Māluṅkyaputta.
It's also called being able to bring about all positions of wealth.
It's also called healing illnesses and extinguishing sins.
It's also known as being able to remove all dangers and fears.
It's also known as something that's praised by all the buddhas together.
It's also known as the blessing of the buddhas' spiritual powers.
It's also called the Dhāraṇī of World Preservation.
You must practice it and not lose sight of it.
It will benefit and bring comfort to all sentient beings.
After the Bhagavān taught this sūtra.
Measureless śrāvakas and bodhisattvas ...
There were gods, humans, asuras, and so forth.
All the masses of people who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced greatly and believed and approved.
They all rejoiced greatly and faithfully accepted and approved of it.
Dhāraṇī of the World Bearer Sutra
